channel.title: Stories on Wheeler Genealogy
channel.description: Recent content in Stories on Wheeler Genealogy

item.title: Carra Inez (Tuttle) Wheeler: Vermont Roots, Connecticut Years, Holyoke Home
item.description: Born in Windsor County, Vermont, Carra Inez Tuttle married John Edward Wheeler and raised a family through Connecticut before returning to Holyoke, Massachusetts.

item.title: From Farm to Storefront: Augustus Tuttle and the A. & O. S. Tuttle Store
item.description: A census snapshot shows Augustus Tuttle as a young farmer in Vermont, but later evidence points to a family business: a Cavendish general store that became a Holyoke dry-goods operation.

item.title: Michael McGinty: From County Leitrim to Chicago
item.description: Born in County Leitrim, Michael McGinty built a life in Chicago—marriage, five sons, work as a plumber, and a long run in the city’s Irish-American neighborhoods.

item.title: From Cranfield, Bedfordshire to New England: A Wheeler Family Story
item.description: A Bedfordshire Wheeler family appears in early New England records, planting roots in Connecticut and Massachusetts through the 1600s.

item.title: Wheeler Genealogy
item.description: Welcome to my genealogy workspace—photo essays, document deep-dives, and research logs.
